question: A colored pixel can only be red, green or blue.

text: Where a colored image would have 3 numbers per pixel, a grayscale one only has 1 number per pixel: the gray intensity.

If I substract 50% to all pixel intensities, the image becomes:

text: Here it is ! A darker or under exposed image with its pixel intensity histogram.

question: If I add 50% to all pixel intensities, the image becomes:

text: Here it is ! A lighter or over exposed image with its pixel intensity histogram.
When you evenly distribute pixel intensities accross the possible range, you get a perfectly adjusted contrast. This is great to help the computer find interesting keypoints in your image !
You can also look at it this way. If you get a straight line accross this figure, it means your histogram (of the previous side) is well equalized.
